%c[default]A leather jacket with Kevlar elements. The traditional outfit of a Bandit - and those choosing to follow that ignoble tradition in the Zone can expect a disproportionally shortened lifespan...

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+15%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+28%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[default]Typically weak Bandit body armor with chain-mail plates sewn into it for slightly better protection. Almost anyone could make one, but few would have the patience to do so...
Bandit Jacket with gas mask - PNV 'Green'
Bandit Jacket with gas mask Mod. 1 - PNV 'Green'

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+5%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+8%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+8%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+5%
%c[255,1,255,255]Radiation: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[default]Typical Bandit outfit - a leather jacket with Kevlar elements. This modification has a gas mask and, as a result, environmental protection is slightly improved. Equipped with this ensemble, you might last more than a single day in the Zone, but don't push your luck...

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+5%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+5%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+5%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+5%
%c[default]A typical thick leather trenchcoat offering very little in terms of environmental protection. Often the uniform of choice for thieves and other sordid individuals found scattered all over the Zone...

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+15%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+23%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[default]Typically meant to be worn as a secondary protective layer over body armor, this thick, formidable, black leather overcoat has become the trademark 'look' of the Bandit Masters. Surprisingly its protective characteristics are very strong, having been manufactured from 100% pure Chimera hide - a tough, sinewy type of leather that needs to be broken in rigorously before it can be worn, by throwing it repeatedly into a 'Roundabout' anomaly...

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+15%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+23%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Stamina: %c[255,1,255,1]+180
%c[default]Typically meant to be worn as a secondary protective layer over body armor, this thick, formidable, black leather overcoat has become the trademark 'look' of the Bandit Masters. Surprisingly its protective characteristics are very strong, having been manufactured from 100% pure Chimera hide - a tough, sinewy type of leather that needs to be broken in rigorously before it can be worn, by throwing it repeatedly into a 'Roundabout' anomaly... This variant of the garment has absorbed further anomalous qualities that provide unique health restoration capabilities when worn...

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+5%
%c[default]Provides slightly better protection than the Leather Trenchcoat and the common Bandit Jacket, but would struggle to cope with the Zone's severe and ever-changing conditions...

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+38%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+15%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+15%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+20%
%c[255,1,255,255]Radiation: %c[255,1,255,1]30%
%c[255,1,255,255]Psionic: %c[255,1,255,1]+5%
%c[255,1,255,255]Carry weight: %c[255,1,255,1]+80kg
%c[default]Exoskeleton designed by Friar under Borov's direction. Similar to other Exoskeleton variants in having extra carrying capacity, but not offering the best protection because of the lack of real science involved in its construction (Bandits not being known for their academic achievements). However, it does serve its designated purpose in granting basic protection while carrying lots of loot...
Duty PSZ-9D Armor Mod. 1 - PNV 'Cats Eye'
Duty PSZ-9D Armor Mod. 1 - PNV 'White Night'

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+20%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Radiation: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[default]Manufactured exclusively for the Duty Faction by the Kiev Defensive Scientific Research Institute, this high-end bodysuit was created for rigorous use throughout the Zone. Comprises a heavy PSZ-12p bulletproof vest, a built-in compensation suit, and a Sphere-12M helmet. Facilitates remarkably high mobility while providing solid protection from bullets, shrapnel, anomalies, and radiation. It can be upgraded so that it rivals the Exoskeleton in terms of protection, but does not have the facility to carry artefacts...
Duty PSZ-9D-2 Armor Mod. 1 - PNV 'Cats Eye'
Duty PSZ-9D-2 Armor Mod. 1 - PNV 'White Night'

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+20%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+20%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Radiation: %c[255,1,255,1]+35%
%c[default]Manufactured exclusively for the Duty Faction by the Kiev Defensive Scientific Research Institute, this high-end bodysuit was created for rigorous use throughout the Zone. Comprises a heavy PSZ-12p bulletproof vest, a built-in compensation suit, and a Sphere-12M helmet with built-in breathing apparatus. Facilitates remarkably high mobility while providing solid protection from bullets, shrapnel, anomalies, and radiation. It can be upgraded so that it rivals the Exoskeleton in terms of protection, but does not have the facility to carry artefacts...

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+70%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+20%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Radiation: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[default]Duty PSZ-9D suit with improved protection against laceration from bites and cuts. This high-end bodysuit comprises a heavy PSZ-12p bulletproof vest, a built-in compensation suit, and a Sphere-12M helmet, and was created for rigorous use throughout the Zone. Manufactured exclusively for the Duty Faction by the Kiev Defensive Scientific Research Institute

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+20%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+40%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+35%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+45%
%c[255,1,255,255]Radiation: %c[255,1,255,1]+45%
%c[default]Functionally identical to the SEVA suit, the PSZ-9MD comprises a high quality PSZ-9D Duty suit, which offers superb protection from bullets, shrapnel and laceration by mutant claws, combined with a Curtain helmet with integrated life support system and anomalous field suppression devices. This is a well-designed protective suit for the Zone, and very popular among Duty veterans

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+35%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+40%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+35%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+40%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+20%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Radiation: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Psionic: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Carry weight: %c[255,1,255,1]+35kg
%c[default]Modified by the Kiev Defensive Scientific Research Institute for the Zone's Duty faction, this customized Exoskeleton is the product of advanced military research, initially intended for the Ukrainian Military for hazardous missions into the Zone. Due to the sheer cost of a single unit, however, as well as the numerous technical problems and design flaws, this unit never reached mass production, although limited numbers continue to be manufactured in clandestine factories to find their way into the Zone. A major benefit of the Exoskeleton is its ability to greatly increase the wearer's physical strength, allowing them to carry more equipment around
SSP-99 Ecologist suit Mod. 1 - PNV 'Cats Eye'
SSP-99 Ecologist suit Mod. 1 - PNV 'White Night'

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+5%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+20%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+45%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+45%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+45%
%c[255,1,255,255]Radiation: %c[255,1,255,1]+45%
%c[default]The SSP-99 suit has a combined air-filtering and conditioning system, with the main body of the suit impervious to heat and electricity, providing near-invulnerability to the Zone's radiation and anomalous activity. For additional safety, the suit has a sub-layer of powdered Urchin artefact, and includes 2nd generation night vision. Designed to be lightweight, and not a military suit, it does not protect against firearms and explosives

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+30%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+20%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+45%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+45%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+45%
%c[255,1,255,255]Radiation: %c[255,1,255,1]+45%
%c[default]Designed for guards working with the Scientific community, this highly modified SSP-99 suit incorporates added body protection from bullets and shrapnel. The suit comprises a closed-cycle breathing module and an integrated anomalous field suppression system, offering anomaly and radiation protection equal to that of the SSP-99 suit, with the bullet protection of the SEVA suit. What's more, it has even better explosion protection, lasts longer, and weighs less than the SEVA, plus 2nd generation night vision, making this one of the best suits around for hazardous work in the Zone
Army Bulletproof Vest Mod.1 - PNV 'Cats Eye'
Army Bulletproof Vest Mod.1 - PNV 'White Night'

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+5%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+5%
%c[255,1,255,255]Radiation: %c[255,1,255,1]+5%
%c[default]A typical Soviet-issue battle dress uniform comprising heavy military boots, and a PSZ-7 (Personal Protection System Model-7) bulletproof vest. Combined with a backpack and combat webbing, this type of uniform is normal issue for most of the Military grunts enlisted throughout the Zone. While offering standard protection from bullets and shrapnel, it is totally ineffective against radiation and anomalies...

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+20%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+20%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+23%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+15%
%c[255,1,255,255]Radiation: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[default]The Berill-5M suit is used by the Russian Spetsnaz 'special purpose regiments'. Specifically modified for the Zone, it includes a PSZ-9A Military bulletproof vest with a Beryllium coating, and a Sphere-08 helmet. The helmet has a double internal latticework of wound copper mesh to protect the wearer from the Zone's unique psionic emanations. Comes in standard European Woodland camouflage pattern

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+20%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+20%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+23%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+15%
%c[255,1,255,255]Radiation: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Bleeding: %c[255,1,255,1]-20%
%c[default]A Berill-5M armored suit whose inner lining is saturated with a streptozoidal lotion, thus significantly speeding up the healing of wounds. It also comes equipped with 1st generation Pilot Night Vision. The suit is particularly durable, being reasonably resistant to occasional firearm damage. Its drawbacks are below average anomaly protection, and its weight...
Military SKAT9M Armor Mod.2 - PNV 'Cats Eye'
Military SKAT9M Armor Mod.2 - PNV 'White Night'

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+35%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+35%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+30%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+30%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+30%
%c[255,1,255,255]Radiation: %c[255,1,255,1]+30%
%c[default]The SKAT9M is a heavy armored suit used by the Ukrainian Military and Stalkers doing Military contract work. It is composed of a PSZ-12p vest, a built-in anomalous field compensation unit, and a Sphere-12 helmet. This suit has quickly become the Military's alternative choice to the Exoskeleton, as it offers similar protection without the extra weight. Durability and above-average anomaly protection have made this suit a favorite among Military professionals and Stalkers alike
Military SKAT10M Armor Mod.3 - PNV 'Cats Eye'
Military SKAT10M Armor Mod.3 - PNV 'White Night'

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+40%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+40%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+35%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+35%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+40%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+30%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+40%
%c[255,1,255,255]Radiation: %c[255,1,255,1]+35%
%c[255,1,255,255]Psionic: %c[255,1,255,1]+20%
%c[default]Based on the SKAT9M heavy armor, the SKAT10 improves mobility by using more lightweight and better protective materials. Composed of a PSZ-12 Mod. 3 Vest, a built-in anomalous field compensation unit, and a specially reinforced Sphere-12 Mk.2 helmet, the suit is ideal for assault operations in areas containing large numbers of anomalies

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+30%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+30%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+60%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+20%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Radiation: %c[255,1,255,1]+15%
%c[255,1,255,255]Carry weight: %c[255,1,255,1]+5kg
%c[default]A first generation Military Exoskeleton prototype, which never went into full scale production due to extremely high manufacturing costs and various, albeit minor, design flaws. Offers good, basic protection against the various dangers encountered throughout the Zone

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+45%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+40%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+40%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+30%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Radiation: %c[255,1,255,1]+15%
%c[255,1,255,255]Carry weight: %c[255,1,255,1]+20kg
%c[default]Exoskeleton suits make use of powerful servo-motors and electrically stimulated muscle fibre bundles to provide the wearer with superior strength and environmental protection. This one is based around an RPS Industries 'Morph Radiation suit', a tight fitting full bodysuit incorporating heavy Kevlar and composite armor plates (which can be upgraded to titanium). These Radsuits also come with specially made tactical helmets and gas masks. A major benefit of the Exoskeleton is its ability to greatly increase the wearer's physical strength, allowing them to carry more equipment around

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+45%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+40%
%c[255,1,255,255]Explosive: %c[255,1,255,1]+40%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+30%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+25%
%c[255,1,255,255]Radiation: %c[255,1,255,1]+15%
%c[255,1,255,255]Carry weight: %c[255,1,255,1]+20kg
%c[default]This 3rd generation Military Exoskeleton prototype originally belonged to a Stalker known as 'Fang', a key member of Strelok's group. The suit never went into full scale production due to extremely high manufacturing costs and various, albeit minor, design flaws. However, limited numbers continue to be manufactured in clandestine factories outside of the Zone. Most of the design defects which used to decrease its mobility have been eliminated, and the suit has been further reinforced to provide excellent protection from bullets and shrapnel, and a good defence against radiation and anomalies

%c[255,1,255,255]Impaction: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Laceration: %c[255,1,255,1]+15%
%c[255,1,255,255]Penetration: %c[255,1,255,1]+13%
%c[255,1,255,255]Burning: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Chemical: %c[255,1,255,1]+5%
%c[255,1,255,255]Electrical: %c[255,1,255,1]+10%
%c[255,1,255,255]Carry weight: %c[255,1,255,1]+5kg
%c[default]Exoskeleton suits make use of powerful servo-motors and electrically stimulated muscle fibre bundles to provide the wearer with superior strength and environmental protection. This one is based around an RPS Industries 'Morph Radiation suit', a tight fitting full bodysuit incorporating heavy Kevlar and composite armor plates (which can be upgraded to titanium). These Radsuits also come with specially made tactical helmets and gas masks. A major benefit of the Exoskeleton is its ability to greatly increase the wearer's physical strength, allowing them to carry more equipment around. This one has been damaged by being left in a harsh environment, possibly with its owner still inside, which has reduced its structural protection characteristics and carrying capacity...

Its design is based on equipment used by Special Forces of the Western armies, including the standard belt-mounted pistol holster and carrying pouch. Due to a special treatment of the base fabric, its structural stability has been improved during physical movement of its armor plates. Overall, its protective properties are slightly better than those of the PSZ-7 Military bulletproof armored suits

%c[default]A specially designed Exoskeleton suit smuggled into the Zone from the west (German attention to detail is evident). Based around an RPS Industries 'Morph Radiation suit', a tight fitting full bodysuit incorporating heavy Kevlar and composite armor plates (which in this case have been upgraded to titanium), these Radsuits also come with specially made tactical helmets and gas masks. A major benefit of the Exoskeleton is its ability to greatly increase the wearer's physical strength, allowing them to carry more equipment around. This one contains numerous additional ammunition pouches than the usual variant, as well as titanium-based armor plating within the Radsuit layer underneath

%c[default]Heavily modified Stalker suit, usually worn with a respirator. Features more armor, and better anomaly, radiation, and psionic protection than any other Stalker suit of this type. Created by an unknown manufacturer, its base is a splinter pattern urban camouflage radiation suit/battledress uniform with reinforced leather arm, elbow and kneepads. Over this is a green Tactical Vest with multiple carrying pouches and a mounting place for either two oxygen tanks, a backpack, or a closed-circuit breathing apparatus for the Curtain helmet life support system (a strong, high visibility 'dome' helmet, similar to that of the SEVA suit)

Providing the wearer with superb anomaly and radiation resistance, as well as high bullet and shrapnel protection, this suit is used exclusively by the Monolith faction, mostly by their veterans and experts. A Bulletproof Vest incorporated into an anti-radiation suit, it is similar in many ways to Duty's PSZ-9MD suit, but with the added benefit of being able to staunch minor bleeding and accelerate the healing of wounds. %c[default]Stalker suit manufactured by 'folk craftsmen'. An effective combination of light military Bulletproof Vest and a rubberized fabric suit, with Kevlar inserts providing protection from weak or distant gunfire. Its former owner was a real 'tourist' in every sense of the word, and often went on extreme excursions into the Zone in this lightweight suit. Needing to distribute his equipment and gains more efficiently, he modified the suit accordingly, resulting in an increased capacity of +10kg over its standard carry weight

%c[default]Rumor has it that Ghost never carried a medkit with him. After recovering this unusual suit from an anomaly, he found it clotted with the jellified bones of its previous owner, which had infused it with the ability to heal automatically... An effective combination of light military Bulletproof Vest and a rubberized fabric suit, with Kevlar inserts providing protection from weak or distant gunfire. Overall, it is lightweight, easily obtainable, and offers reasonable protection against radiation and anomalies...

%c[default]Unique Stalker Suit formerly owned by the legendary Strelok. A very effective combination of high-grade military Bulletproof Vest and heavy, dual-layer rubberized fabric suit offers good protection against radiation and anomalies, while its double-reinforced titanium plates safeguard against automatic gunfire. Furthermore, improved wear and tear characteristics prevent excessive damage from both combat situations and the inherent dangers of the Zone. All this, coupled with the ability to heal the wearer automatically over time, makes this a singularly exceptional suit...

%c[default]Stalker suit produced by Freedom's armorers. An effective combination of medium grade military Bulletproof Vest with a heavy duty rubberized fabric suit, with Kevlar inserts providing protection from weak or distant gunfire. The fabric of the suit has been infused with a proprietary 'special treatment' to increase its resistance to anomalies. An insulated wire mesh has been woven into the fabric to protect against both electrical damage and electromagnetic influence. The suit also has Night Vision capabilities...
Freedom SEVA suit Mod 2 - PNV 'Cats Eye'
Freedom SEVA suit Mod 2 - PNV 'White Night'

%c[default]The SEVA suit is a CBRN (Chemical, Biological, Radiological, Nuclear) Protective suit developed by MIR-12, a secretive organization that arrived in the Zone shortly after the second 'incident' in 2006 that nobody talks about - at least, not any more... The SEVA suit represents the pinnacle of personal protection technology available in the Zone, combining a lightweight Bulletproof Vest, a closed cycle breathing system, and an integrated AFSU (Anomalous Field Suppression Unit)

%c[default]Manufactured exclusively by Freedom's armorers, this exoskeleton makes use of electrically actuated muscle fibre bundles and powerful servo-motors to provide the wearer with superior strength and environmental protection. This one is based around an RPS Industries 'Morph Radiation suit', a tight fitting full bodysuit incorporating heavy Kevlar and composite armor plates (which can be upgraded to titanium). These Radsuits also come with specially made tactical helmets and gas masks. The suit allows for a +25kg carrying capacity...

%c[default]Armor modified by means of antigravitational artefacts known as 'Cobblestones', creating a Bulletproof Vest that is much heavier than normal, but with substantially extended carrying capacity. Unfortunately, because of the anomalous vacuity of Cobblestones, the suit seems to attract significant physical damage to the wearer, a highly unwelcome bug in need of ironing out...

%c[default]This basic outfit consists of a sky blue and white camouflage jacket with a hood drawn over the head, gray trousers, black cowl, tactical vest, kneepads and hiking boots. The suit also includes a container for holding artefacts. Designed for conducting search operations in areas of low anomalous activity, its high quality materials grant it both flexibility and robustness in the field, making this suit a favorite of Clear Sky from its scouts to its commanders...

%c[default]Produced by skilled craftsmen in the Clear Sky faction, the CS-1 body armor comprises a tactical vest with carrying pouches and medium grade military Kevlar, a tactical helmet with gas mask and full-vision goggles, a sky blue/white camouflage shirt, dark trousers with metal kneepads, and rugged hiking boots. Heavier, Kevlar-padded panels have been added to the arms and legs to increase the suit's protective performance. As such, it provides good protection against the radiation and various anomalies found in the Swamps...

%c[default]Manufactured exclusively for the Clear Sky faction, this exoskeleton makes use of electrically actuated muscle fibre bundles and powerful servo-motors to provide the wearer with superior strength and environmental protection. This one is based around an RPS Industries 'Morph Radiation suit' - a tight fitting full bodysuit incorporating heavy Kevlar and composite armor plates (which can be upgraded to titanium). These Radsuits also come with specially made tactical helmets and gas masks. This one allows for a +30kg carrying capacity...

%c[default]The main body of the Clear Sky SSP-99 suit is made with materials resistant to both heat and electricity. This, coupled with an integrated air filtration and conditioning system, provides near-invulnerability to the radiation and anomalous activity found in the Zone. For additional protection, the suit has a bonded sub-strata of powdered Urchin artefacts, and also includes second generation Night Vision. However, as this suit was designed for field exploration, and not combat, it offers little in the way of protection against man-made firearms and explosives...

%c[255,1,255,255]Psionic: %c[255,1,255,1]+100%\n%c[default]A typical Bandit Trenchcoat, only white in color - very similar to a medical or lab coat. The mask has been bonded to the coat in a ceramic-based centrifuge, and the built-in Night Vision cannot be upgraded. While offering no protection whatsoever against bullets or shrapnel, it possesses the singular property of totally negating the Psi-influence of a Controller. The development process of this extraordinary garment is undocumented, although the involvement of the Dharma Initiative is highly suspected...

%c[default]Used primarily by scientists of the Monolith faction, and developed in a secret laboratory deep inside the Zone, this suit comprises a closed-cycle breathing module and an integrated anomalous field suppression system. Due to the conditions in which Monolithians survive and thrive, anomaly and radiation protection is vastly superior to that of Clear Sky's SSP-99 suit, as is the advanced Night Vision. These suits are so rare as to have been previously thought non-existent...

%c[default]This suit came by its name honestly, being handcrafted by a Stalker who used to be a firefighter in Moscow. Basically a Scientific suit in which its lining, and the transparent shield from the helmet, have been completely replaced with heat resistant counterparts, plus high quality Night Vision. As a result it has become much heavier to wear due to the asbestos lining used to make it 100% flame-resistant. Though it also offers some protection against chemical agents, bear in mind that as the suit deteriorates, so will its fire-retardant characteristics...

%c[default]Tirex was a Stalker who travelled deep into the Zone, though how this suit fell into his hands is unknown. What we do know is that this armor was modified by Tirex and then sold to Shaku, who used the template to make copies that were circulated around the Zone. It's a fairly unremarkable suit with low protection characteristics (though still higher than a non-upgraded suit), but this is outweighed by an unprecedented storage capability, allowing for significantly more weight to be carried than most other suits, including Exoskeletons. This would have appealed to Tirex, who needed to carry lots of swag back to safer areas where it could be sold or traded...

c[default]Designed for assault operations in areas of anomalous activity, this suit comprises a PSZ-12p heavy military bulletproof suit, an integrated compensation suit, and a Sphere-12M helmet. It offers a balanced system of anomaly protection, plus substantial protection from bullets and shrapnel, without decreasing the soldier's mobility

c[default]A SSP-99 chemical protection suit specifically designed for conditions in the Zone, and used by scientific expeditions and the eco-stalkers who work with them. It has an integrated air-filtering and air-conditioning system, and is resistant to heat and electricity, providing solid protection from radiation and biochemical anomalies. It is not designed for combat, and provides neither bullet nor shrapnel protection. Built into the suit is a heavily shielded container for carrying artefacts
Prototype Nanosuit V2 Mod 3 - PNV 'Cats Eye'

%c[default]Experimental test sample of the armored Nanosuit, with plenty of further expansion capacity, but as yet untested in the Zone. After the success of the Zell projects, scientists bought nano technology from the Americans and made the suit available to Ukraine. Make no mistake, this self-repairing armored suit is one of the best you'll ever wear, with the potential to surpass even a fully upgraded military SKAT15 when it comes to personal protection from the hazards of the Zone. Rumor has it that Sakharov knows more than any scientist or mechanic in the Zone about this suit, and can even supply the rare and specialized upgrades available for it...

%c[default]One of just two original Ukrainian Nanosuits that were modified by scientists for deep Zone exploration. The self-repairing capability of this suit ensures that it can never wear out, due to the protective outer layer that absorbs light and uses it to regenerate the semi-organic nano particles within its molecular structure. These particles also permeate the artificial muscle fibers extending throughout the suit, allowing the wearer to carry loads of up to 250kg above normal without long-lasting muscle damage or fatigue. Rumor has it that Sakharov knows more than any scientist or mechanic in the Zone about this suit, and can even supply the rare and specialized upgrades available for it...

%c[default]One of just two original Ukrainian Nanosuits that were modified by scientists for deep Zone exploration. The self-repairing capability of this suit ensures that it can never wear out, due to the protective outer layer that absorbs light and uses it to regenerate the semi-organic nano particles within its molecular structure. These particles also permeate the artificial muscle fibers extending throughout the suit, allowing the wearer to carry loads of up to 150kg above normal without long-lasting muscle damage or fatigue. This specially modified 'medical' version has the ability to rapidly staunch bleeding, and accelerate health and strength recovery, making it invaluable in areas where hazards are expected but unknown. Sakharov is the Zone expert on this genus of suit, and can even obtain the rare and specialized upgrades available for it...
